UNDATED (KTHV) – Little Rock native and current Pittsburgh Steelers running back DeAngelo Williams was denied a request to honor his late mother. 
According to a story from Jeremy Fowler of ESPN , Williams was told on the phone by the NFL vice president of football operations Troy Vincent that he could not wear pink accessories throughout the entire NFL season due to the league’s no-exceptions uniform policy. The NFL allows players to wear pink during the month of October. Williams' mother, Sandra Hill, passed away in May 2014. 
According to ESPN, Williams chose to dye the tips of his hair pink and reportedly bought 53 mammograms at hospitals in Charlotte, where he played most of his career, and his current city of Pittsburgh. Williams’ mother died at the age of 53.
